FullStack Labs is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.We’re most proud of:Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas.Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies.Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users.Our 4.7-star rating on GlassDoor.Our client Net Promoter Score of 64, twice the industry average.Sustained growth of 100% - 200% per year.Job Summary:FullStack Labs is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Director of Artificial Intelligence to join our team. As the Director of AI, you will be responsible for building and leading our AI consulting practice. Your primary responsibilities will include developing technical vetting processes for hiring AI developers, initiating and overseeing client engagements that involve AI, working with the sales and marketing team to grow our AI consulting practice, and evaluating acquisitions of other AI consultancies. Although this role is director-level, there will be times when you will be expected to roll up your sleeves and directly contribute to projects.Responsibilities:Ability and willingness to directly contribute code, data management, and other hands-on work to internal and client-facing projects.Develop technical vetting processes for hiring AI developers, such as coding challenges and interview questions.Evaluate candidates and help select and build teams based on project specifications.Integrate AI into our existing vetting technology to assess software developers.Oversee client engagements that involve AI, ensuring their success and satisfaction.Work with the sales and marketing team to expand our AI consulting practice and drive growth.Evaluate potential acquisitions of other AI consultancies to expand our capabilities.Qualifications: 5+ years of experience building and leading AI teams.Expertise in developing AI solutions for various industries.Strong technical background in at least two of the following: machine learning, natural language processing, computer vision, neural networks, and other AI technologies.Experience creating and implementing technical vetting processes to assess potential hires.Experience managing client engagements and leading teams.Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Proven ability to work independently and lead a team.Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.Benefits:Competitive salary and stock options. Paid Time Off (vacation, sick leave, maternity and paternity leave, holidays).100% remote work.The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies.Health, dental, vision insurance.401(k) w/ 4% match.Virtual company events each month.Ample opportunity for career advancement.Continuing education opportunities.If you are a highly motivated and experienced Director of Artificial Intelligence with a passion for building and leading successful AI consulting practices, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.FullStack Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process.Learn more about our Applicants Privacy Notice .
